content:
tor of
the hospital says, “Tough luck, I agree, but you’ve now got to stay in bed,
with the violinist plugged into you, for the rest of your life. Because remem-
ber this. All persons have a right to life, and violinists are persons. Granted
you have a right to decide what happens in and to your body, but a person’s
right  to  life  outweighs  your  right  to  decide  what  happens  in  and  to  your
body. So you cannot ever be unplugged from him.” I imagine you would
regard this as outrageous,
